CatDescriptText: Mr. Clifford Whippenwebb, 7 Petrosky Street, Woods Run, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 19, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Should a church congregation pay its ministers not less than a 'cost-of-living' salary, maintain rent-free (with utilities) living quarters for him, pay for vacations for him and his family (if he has one) and, in some instances, hold special 'gratuity days' in his behalf, also?" answer reads: "A minister should have a cost-of-living salary, rent-free living quarters, vacation with pay and special days, all given by the congregation. The reason is that the minister serves the community."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of a Clifford Whippenwebb, wearing a plaid hat, light colored shirt and pants, standing with hands on hips in front of lawn with trees and wooden fence
